00017 package WeBWorK::Request;
00018 
00019 =head1 NAME
00020 
00021 WeBWorK::Request - a request to the WeBWorK system, a subclass of
00022 Apache::Request with additional WeBWorK-specific fields.
00023 
00024 =cut
00025 
00026 use strict;
00027 use warnings;
00028 
00029 use mod_perl;
00030 use constant MP2 => ( exists $ENV{MOD_PERL_API_VERSION} and $ENV{MOD_PERL_API_VERSION} >= 2 );
00031 
00032 
00033 use WeBWorK::Localize;
00034 
00035 # This class inherits from Apache::Request under mod_perl and Apache2::Request under mod_perl2
00036 BEGIN {
00037     push @WeBWorK::Request::ISA, "WeBWorK::Localize";
00038     if (MP2) {
00039         require Apache2::Request;
00040         Apache2::Request->import;
00041         push @WeBWorK::Request::ISA, "Apache2::Request";
00042     } else {
00043         require Apache::Request;
00044         Apache::Request->import;
00045         push @WeBWorK::Request::ISA, "Apache::Request";
00046     }
00047 }
00048 
00049 # Apache2::Request's param method doesn't support setting parameters, so we need to provide the
00050 # behavior in this class if we're running under mod_perl2.
00051 BEGIN {
00052     if (MP2) {
00053         *param = *mutable_param;
00054     }
00055 }
00056 
00057 sub mutable_param {
00058     my $self = shift;
00059     
00060     if (not defined $self->{paramcache}) {
00061         my @names = $self->SUPER::param;
00062         @{$self->{paramcache}}{@names} = map { [ $self->SUPER::param($_) ] } @names;
00063     }
00064     
00065     @_ or return keys %{$self->{paramcache}};
00066     
00067     my $name = shift;
00068     if (@_) {
00069         my $val = shift;
00070         if (ref $val eq "ARRAY") {
00071             $self->{paramcache}{$name} = [@$val]; # make a copy
00072         } else {
00073             $self->{paramcache}{$name} = [$val];
00074         }
00075     }
00076     return unless exists $self->{paramcache}{$name};
00077     return wantarray ? @{$self->{paramcache}{$name}} : $self->{paramcache}{$name}->[0];
00078 }
00079 
00080 =head1 CONSTRUCTOR
00081 
00082 =over
00083 
00084 =item new(@args)
00085 
00086 Creates an new WeBWorK::Request. All arguments are passed to Apache::Request's
00087 constructor. You must specify at least an Apache request_rec object.
00088 
00089 =for comment
00090 
00091 From: http://search.cpan.org/~joesuf/libapreq-1.3/Request/Request.pm#SUBCLASSING_Apache::Request
00092 
00093 If the instances of your subclass are hash references then you can actually
00094 inherit from Apache::Request as long as the Apache::Request object is stored in
00095 an attribute called "r" or "_r". (The Apache::Request class effectively does the
00096 delegation for you automagically, as long as it knows where to find the
00097 Apache::Request object to delegate to.)
00098 
00099 =cut
00100 
00101 sub new {
00102     my ($invocant, @args) = @_;
00103     my $class = ref $invocant || $invocant;
00104     # construct the appropriate superclass instance depending on mod_perl version
00105     my $apreq_class = MP2 ? "Apache2::Request" : "Apache::Request";
00106     return bless { r => $apreq_class->new(@args) }, $class;
00107 }
00108 
00109 =back
00110 
00111 =cut
00112 
00113 =head1 METHODS
00114 
00115 =over
00116 
00117 =item ce([$new])
00118 
00119 Return the course environment (WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment) associated with this
00120 request. If $new is specified, set the course environment to $new before
00121 returning the value.
00122 
00123 =cut
00124 
00125 sub ce {
00126     my $self = shift;
00127     $self->{ce} = shift if @_;
00128     return $self->{ce};
00129 }
00130 
00131 =item db([$new])
00132 
00133 Return the database (WeBWorK::DB) associated with this request. If $new is
00134 specified, set the database to $new before returning the value.
00135 
00136 =cut
00137 
00138 sub db {
00139     my $self = shift;
00140     $self->{db} = shift if @_;
00141     return $self->{db};
00142 }
00143

00145

00147 is specified, set the authenticator to $new before returning the value.
00148 
00149 =cut
00150 
00151 sub authen {

00174

00183 sub language_handle {
00184     my $self = shift;
00185     $self->{language_handle} = shift if @_;
00186     return $self->{language_handle};
00187 }
00188 
00189 sub maketext {
00190     my $self = shift;
00191     # $self->{language_handle}->maketext(@_);
00192     &{ $self->{language_handle} }(@_);
00193 }
00194 
00195 =item location()
00196 
00197 Overrides the location() method in Apache::Request (or Apache2::Request) so that
00198 if the location is "/", the empty string is returned.
00199 
00200 =cut
00201 
00202 sub location {
00203     my $self = shift;
00204     my $location = $self->SUPER::location;
00205     return $location eq "/" ? "" : $location;
00206 }
00207 
00208 =back

00210 =cut
